newsitem.title: USA: US Senator warns WestLB against Iran loan.
newsitem.headline: US Senator warns WestLB against Iran loan.

text.p: A powerful U.S. Senator on Thursday warned Germany's Westdeutsche Landesbank Girozentrale against making a $90 million loan to an Iranian oil company.
Senator Al D'Amato said the loan reportedly would be used by the Offshore Engineering and Construction Company of Iran to finance the development of the Souroush oil field in the Persian Gulf.
In a letter to Westdeutsche Landesbank chief Friedel Neuber, the New York Republican said the deal would be a clear violation of the 1996 Iran Libya Sanctions Act (ILSA).
D'Amato was a key author of the legislation, which imposes U.S. sanctions on any company that invests $40 million or more in a 12-month period in the petroleum sectors of Iran or Libya.
"This scheme seems to be nothing more than an effort to willfully circumvent ILSA," D'Amato wrote.
"We view any business deal that provides Iran with the hard currency to develop its energy sector as a direct threat to U.S. national security," he said.
If the bank goes ahead with the loan, it will become a "pariah company known for supporting rogue states," D'Amato added.
